newsitem.title: JAPAN: JGBs to focus on Tokyo share prices.
newsitem.headline: JGBs to focus on Tokyo share prices.

text.p: The key March Japanese government bond futures contract is expected to be caught in a range near 125.00 on Friday.
JGBs will likely be supported on the downside by investors' bargain-hunting, traders said.
A fall in Tokyo share prices, on the other hand, would make JGBs heavy on the upperside, they said.

"If Tokyo share prices fall below 20,000 yen, profit-taking sales of JGBs may appear," a trader for a city bank's securities affiliate said. City banks in particular, may be forced to sell JGBs if that happens, the trader said.
The March contract's rise on LIFFE will also provide support to JGBs in Tokyo, a trader for a brokerage house said.
The March closed at 125.01 on LIFFE overnight, up from Thursday's Tokyo close of 124.89.
The first trader said he did not think the Bank of Japan would raise interest rates at the beginning of the year.
"Worries about (Japan's) financial system are beginning to re-emerge, and I doubt interest rates would be raised before (corporate) book-closings at the end of March," the trader said.
